articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Reply Messages to Heads of Foreign State
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Reply Messages to Heads of Foreign State 
 Pyongyang, January 28 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un sent messages to heads of political parties and state of different countries in reply to their messages expressing profound condolences over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 They were the Russian president, the Cuban President of the Council of Ministers who doubles as first secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba and president of the Council of State, the Lao president who doubles as general secretary of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party, the Nepali president, the Lebanese president, the president of Myanmar, the Mongolian president, the Bahraini king, the Bangladeshi president, the Syrian president who doubles as regional secretary of the Arab Baath Socialist Party, the Sri Lankan president, the Cambodian great king and king, the Kuwaiti emir, the Thai king, the Pakistani president, the chief of the Palestinian National Authority who doubles as Palestinian president and chairman of the Executive Committee of the Palestine Liberation Organization, the Kazakh president, the emir of the States of Qatar, the Kirgyz president, the Turkmen president, the Armenian president, the Afghan president, 
					
					 the Omani sultan, the Jordanian king, the Iranian president, the Indonesian president, the president of Belarus, the Croatian president, the Spanish king, the Ghanaian president, the Guinean president, the Namibian president, the Nigerian president and commander-in-chief of the Armed Forces, the South African president, the Nigerien president, the Mauritanian president, the president of Burkina Faso, the president of Sao Tome and Principe, the Sudanese president, the Senegalese president, the Seychellois president, the Zambian president, the Equatorial Guinean president who doubles as president of the African Union, the Chadian president and head of state, the Kenyan president, the Tanzanian president, the Congolese president, the president of the Democratic Republic of Congo, the Tunisian president, the Algerian president, the Angolan president, the Ugandan president, the Eritrean president, the  chairman of the Supreme Council of the Armed Forces of Egypt, the Ethiopian pr
					
					 esident, the Guyanese president, the Nicaraguan president, the president of the Commonwealth of Dominica, the Brazilian president, the chairman of the Central Committee of the Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist), the secretary general of the United Malays National Organization of Malaysia, the general chairman of the Central Directive Council of the Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle, the general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of India (Marxist), the secretary general of the African National Congress of South Africa, the chairman of the Federation for Mauritania and the coordinator of the National Coordinating Committee of the Workers' Party of Mexico.
					
					 He also sent similar messages to the prime ministers of Nepal, Mongolia, Bahrain, Pakistan, Qatar, Lesotho, Grenada and Belize, the secretary general of the International Kim Il Sung Prize Council who doubles as director-general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, the director general of the International Kim Il Sung Fund and the secretary general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea.
					
					 In the messages he expressed deep thanks for sending profound condolences and sincere sympathy on the demise of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and those countries would invariably grow stronger, he wished successes to them.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Greetings from King of Lesotho
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Greetings from King of Lesotho
 Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a message of greeting from Letsie III, king of Lesotho, on Jan. 9.
					 The message said:
					
					 I have an honor to, on behalf of the government and people of Lesotho and on my own, offer sincere congratulations and best wishes to Your Excellency on the assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 I ardently hope that the friendly and cooperative relations between our two fraternal countries would continue to develop in the mutual interests of the two peoples under your leadership.
					
					 I sincerely wish you good health and happiness and, at the same time, the DPRK people peace, happiness and prosperity.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Greetings from President of Belarus
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Greetings from President of Belarus
 Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a message of greeting from Aleksandr Lukashenko, president of Belarus, on Jan. 1.
					 The message offered sincere greetings and best wishes to Kim Jong Un on the New Year and wished him happiness and prosperity.

articles.title: Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Bangladeshi President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Bangladeshi President
 Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a congratulatory message from President of Bangladesh Zillur Rahman on Jan. 13.
					 The message said:
					
					 Your Excellency Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army
					
					 I, on behalf of the people of Bangladesh and on my own, would like to extend the most heartfelt congratulations to you on your becoming the supreme leader of the DPRK.
					
					 It is my firm belief that the friendly relations between our two countries will continue to develop under your wise leadership.
					
					 I sincerely wish you good health and happiness and the people of the DPRK sustained peace and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un 
 Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un on Jan. 25 received a message of greeting from Tunisian President Al Moncef Al Marzouki on the Lunar New Year.
					 The message said:
					
					 I, on behalf of the government and people of Tunisia and on my own, would like to extend the most heartfelt greetings to Your Excellency on the Lunar New Year's Day. 
					
					 It is my pleasure that I sincerely wish you good health and happiness and the friendly Korean people greater progress and prosperity.
					
					 Availing myself of this happy opportunity, I assure you that we will make efforts to further consolidate the friendly and cooperative relations between two countries in the interests of the two peoples.

articles.title: Congratulatory Message to Jordan's King
articles.content:
Congratulatory Message to Jordan's King
 Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Sunday sent a message to King of Jordan Abdullah â…¡ congratulating him on his 50th birthday.
					 Kim in the message sincerely wished the king good health and happiness as well as success in his noble work for the country's progress and prosperity.

articles.title: GFTUK Central Committee Meets
articles.content:
GFTUK Central Committee Meets
 Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- The 70th plenary meeting of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea (GFTUK) took place here Sunday.
					 It was attended by members and alternate members of the GFTUK Central Committee and trade union officials in Pyongyang and localities.
					
					 Its participants observed a moment's silence in memory of leader Kim Jong Il in humblest reverence.
					
					 The meeting discussed the issue of thoroughly implementing the militant tasks laid down in the decision of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, the joint calls of the Central Committee and Central Military Commission of the WPK and the joint New Year editorial.
					
					 Hyon Sang Ju, chairman of the C.C., the GFTUK, made a report to be followed by speeches.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Heightening Vigilance against Imperialists' Deceptive Artifice
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Heightening Vigilance against Imperialists' Deceptive Artifice
 Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- The imperialists pretend to be "peace champions," becoming more talkative about "peace" and stability" than ever before. But this is nothing but a crafty and sinister artifice to benumb the vigilance of the world people and cover up their aggressive and predatory aims.
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 The prevailing situation requires the world people not to be taken in by the imperialists' crafty deceptive ruse, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 It is necessary, first of all, to be vigilant against the imperialists talking about "freedom" and "democracy" while pretending not to seek any aggressive aim.
					
					 The "freedom" and "democracy" touted by the U.S. are part of its moves for "globalization" and its immediate goal is to do harm to and bring down the political system in the anti-U.S. independent countries and nations by sending them the wind of freedom.
					
					 It is also necessary to guard against the imperialists' behavior of styling themselves as "mediators" and "guarantors" in settling disputes. 
					
					 It is the trite method of the imperialists to fish in troubled waters by sowing the seeds of discord and antagonism among other countries and nations and stoke them.
					
					 It is particularly important to be vigilant against the imperialists' trumpeting about "peace."
					
					 They still keep military bases and troops for aggression in different countries and regions and stage ceaseless and reckless war maneuvers, while giving lip-service to "peace."
					
					 It is the scenario of the U.S. imperialists to carry out their strategy for world domination by force of arms. Its main thrust is to bring Northeast Asia under their control and its core is to ignite another Korean war with south Korea as a base.
					
					 One should not harbor any illusion about the imperialists. It is essential to unite close with a firm revolutionary stand against them and intensify the struggle against them. What is more important is to firmly maintain the principle of independence against imperialism and direct the spearhead of attack to it, not regarding its crafty deceptive ruse as a change in its intrinsic nature.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Kim Jong Il's Exploits in Leading Songun Revolution
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Kim Jong Il's Exploits in Leading Songun Revolution  
Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- DPRK major paper Rodong Sinmun Sunday dedicates an article to the 9th anniversary of the publication of general secretary Kim Jong Il's work "The Songun-based Revolutionary Line Is a Great Revolutionary Line of Our Era and an Ever-Victorious Banner of Our Revolution".
					 The work, published on Jan. 29, 2003, comprehensively deals with the essential character of the Songun revolutionary line, Songun politics of the Workers' Party of Korea and its validity and invincibility. 
					
					 The exploits performed by Kim Jong Il in steering the Songun revolution serve as an eternal treasure of the Korean revolution and a driving force encouraging Kim Il Sung's nation, Kim Jong Il's Korea to bring a rosy future, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The immortal leadership exploits of Kim Jong Il lie in that he developed in depth the Songun idea of the WPK, thus providing an all-powerful treasured sword for victoriously advancing the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					 Kim Jong Il's Songun politics provides a sure guarantee for winning one victory after another in defending socialism by drastically augmenting the politico-ideological and military strength of the People's Army.
					
					 Thanks to his clairvoyant wisdom and outstanding leadership, the driving force of the revolution with the army as a pillar has grown remarkably stronger and the unity of the ranks of the Songun revolution has become more unbreakable than ever before. 
					
					 It is the immortal Songun revolutionary exploits of Kim Jong Il that he laid a solid foundation for winning victory in building a thriving nation by raising the army's role as a pioneer.
					
					 His Songun leadership was the main source of strength that made it possible to get the revolutionary spirit and militant stamina of the People's Army prevailed in the whole society and encouraged the people to bring about a big leap forward and dramatic changes in building a thriving nation. 
					
					 Thanks to the leadership of another brilliant Songun commander the dear respected Kim Jong Un, identical to Kim Jong Il, the future of the DPRK is in safe hands and the revolutionary cause of Juche is sure to triumph, concludes the article.

articles.title: Turkish President on Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Turkish President on Relations with DPRK
 Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- DPRK Ambassador to Turkey Ju Wang Hwan presented his credentials to Turkish President Abdulah Gul on Jan. 24.
					 The president once again expressed deep condolences over the passing of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He sincerely wished successes to the dear respected Kim Jong Un, the supreme leader of the Workers' Party of Korea, state and army of the DPRK.
					
					 Expressing hope that everything would go on well in the DPRK under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, he said that Turkey would develop its relations with the DPRK.

articles.title: Ecuador Decides to Hold Three Commanders of Mt. Paektu as Honorary Citizens
articles.content:
Ecuador Decides to Hold Three Commanders of Mt. Paektu as Honorary Citizens
 Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- Caluma City, Bolivar Province, Ecuador decided to register President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk as honorary citizens.
					 A decision on awarding honorary citizenship to the three commanders of Mt. Paektu was adopted at the city government on Jan. 20.
					
					 The decision said:
					
					 The Democratic People's Republic of Korea has contributed to strengthening man-centered socialism by embodying the Juche idea.
					
					 The Caluma City Government of Bolivar Province of the Republic of Ecuador decides to register HE President Kim Il Sung, HE Marshal Kim Jong Il and anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk as honorary citizens of the city.
					
					 This reflects the Caluma citizens' profound reverence for the three great persons, their friendship towards the Korean people, their sympathy with the Korean revolution based on the Juche idea and their will to boost the bonds of friendship and solidarity with the Korean people.

articles.title: Nepali Newspaper on 100-Year History of Kim Il Sung's Korea
articles.content:
Nepali Newspaper on 100-Year History of Kim Il Sung's Korea
 Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- Nepali newspaper Arpan on Jan. 20 carried articles introducing the DPRK with a photo of President Kim Il Sung.
					 In an article titled "A 100-year history of Kim Il Sung's Korea" the paper noted that Kim Il Sung defeated U.S. and Japanese imperialisms and exalted the sovereignty and dignity of the nation by arousing all the people under the banner of the Juche idea.
					
					 The 100-year history of Kim Il Sung's Korea is a history in which the DPRK turned into a powerful socialist state, the paper said, adding that the DPRK has made rapid progress in all fields under the wise leadership of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The paper said in an article "Juche idea and world conference" that a world conference on the Juche idea is to be held in Pyongyang in April, 2012. It went on:
					
					 The Juche idea fathered by Kim Il Sung, founder of socialist Korea, has been developed in depth by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Korean people became the proud masters of the sovereign and independent state under the banner of the Juche idea and built a socialist power, independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence.

articles.title: Wrong Court Decision Protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
Wrong Court Decision Protested in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- The puppet Seoul Central District Court of south Korea Friday sentenced south Korean Ri Yun Sop to a harsh prison term and others on charges of violation of the ill-famed "National Security Law."
					 The court took this action against him on charges that he conducted information activities through "With the Century", reminiscences of President Kim Il Sung, and books dealing with the Juche idea, national reunification, the revolutionary mass line and others and posted on Internet articles and animation files praising the DPRK.
					
					 Ri Yun Sop called a press conference in protest against the above-said court ruling.
					
					 He termed the NSL which punishes any patriotic movement for reunification as draconic.
					
					 He said that he would make every effort to put an end to division, the nation's greatest pain, and bring earlier Korea's reunification.

articles.title: Freight Transportation in Liaoning, China
articles.content:
Freight Transportation in Liaoning, China
 Beijing, January 29 (KCNA) -- Liaoning Province of China transported 780 million tons of cargo through ports in 2011, 15.3 percent of increase over 2010.
					 The province plans to raise it to 1.1 billion tons till the end of the 12th Five-year Plan.

articles.title: Vietnamese President Calls for Accelerating Socialist Construction
articles.content:
Vietnamese President Calls for Accelerating Socialist Construction 
 Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- President of Vietnam Truong Tan Sang in a message on Jan. 23 called on the party, people and army to unite to accelerate socialist construction.
					 The president underscored the need to weather difficulties and trials and launch a patriotic emulation, confident of victory in the cause of "renovation" and bright future of the country, and thus successfully carry out all tasks. 
					
					 He also called for stepping up industrialization and modernization of the country to expedite socialist construction, defend the country and provide its people with a happier life.

articles.title: "We Do Not Need to Sell Oil to Europe": Iranian President
articles.content:
"We Do Not Need to Sell Oil to Europe": Iranian President
 Tehran, January 28 (KCNA) -- Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad said Thursday Iran does not need to sell its oil to European countries, the semi-official Mehr news agency reported.
					 The European Union (EU) on Monday imposed further sanctions against Iran's oil exports as well as its central bank, a move aimed to ramp up pressure over the country's disputed nuclear program.
					
					 Sanctions cannot stop Iran's progress, Ahmadinejad made the remarks when addressing a group of people in the southeastern city of Kerman.

articles.title: Sanctions on Iran Not to Affect Gas Pipeline: Pakistan
articles.content:
Sanctions on Iran Not to Affect Gas Pipeline: Pakistan
 Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- Pakistan said on Thursday that international sanctions on Iran will not affect a multi-billion gas pipeline between the two countries, which is crucial for the country's growing energy requirements.
					 "Pakistan is committed to the Iran-Pakistan gas pipeline and sanctions do not cover this project," Pakistani Foreign Office spokesman Abdul Basit said at a press briefing at Foreign Office.
					
					 He said Pakistan is studying the U.S. legislation about sanctions on Iran but it is clear that the Iran-Pakistan gas pipeline is not covered by them.
					
					 Pakistan did not bow to American pressure on the project and insisted that it will go ahead with the plan to meet its fast growing energy needs.

articles.title: Belarus Opposes West's New Sanctions against Iran: Foreign Ministry
articles.content:
Belarus Opposes West's New Sanctions against Iran: Foreign Ministry
 Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Belarus clarified its stand of opposing the West's new sanctions against Iran on Jan. 24.
					 The unilateral sanctions on Iran may escalate the tensions in the Near East, a strategically important region, the ministry said, adding they may bring unpredictable consequences. 
					
					 Belarus considers any unilateral sanctions as ineffective, it said.

articles.title: Iran Rejects U.S. Military Threats: FM Spokesman
articles.content:
Iran Rejects U.S. Military Threats: FM Spokesman
 Tehran, January 28 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Iranian foreign ministry on Jan. 25 accused the United States of having threatened military actions.
					 The U.S. chief executive recently cited Iran's peaceful nuclear development as an excuse to use forces, the spokesman said, branding it as part of his election campaign in the run-up to the presidential election.
					
					 That is why he draws attention to Iran's nuclear issue in an effort to cover up the mistakes he has made during his office, the spokesman added.

articles.title: French Manufacturers Less Confident with Business Climate
articles.content:
French Manufacturers Less Confident with Business Climate
 Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- French enterprises are undergoing serious management difficulties due to the continued economic depression.
					 French business leaders showed more pessimism about the economy and manufacturing activity in January, with the monthly sentiment indicator declined to 91, three points down from December, the national statistics bureau Insee said Monday.

articles.title: MBC Media Persons Boycott Program Production
articles.content:
MBC Media Persons Boycott Program Production
 Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- Media persons of MBC of south Korea launched an action to totally boycott the program production on Jan. 25 in protest against the puppet authorities' crackdown on media.
					 Reporters and announcers of the MBC council of journalists and council of video producers accused the present chief executive of appointing his confidants to important posts of the company, thus making MBC lose creditability of the audience and reducing it to the most unfair one. 
					
					 They chided the MBC management for underreporting stories laying bare the corruption of the ruling quarters such as purchase of sites for houses in Naegok-dong and mentioning no word about actions for getting the registration fee halved and opposing the south Korea-U.S. FTA.
					
					 They condemned the head of the report headquarters and the director of the report department, in particular, for trying to punish those who tell truth while going busy with releasing misinformation.
					
					 We have turned out in our action, unable to overlook the present situation any longer, they said, adding they would fight on till their demands for the resignation of the above-said guys and others are met.

articles.title: Joint Military Exercises to Be Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Joint Military Exercises to Be Staged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet war-like forces decided to stage Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises, known to be a saber-rattling for a preemptive attack on the DPRK, from Feb. 27 to April 30.
					 This was disclosed by a man concerned of the U.S. imperialist aggression troops in south Korea on Jan. 26.
					
					 They would reportedly involve more than ten thousand U.S. imperialist aggression forces including those overseas, hundreds of thousands of south Korean puppet troops and huge latest war hardware including means for preemptive nuclear strike.
					
					 The warmongers plan to stage large-scale war maneuvers under the simulated conditions of invasion against the DPRK in land, seas and sky including mobile and attack drills and drills for special operation.
					
					 It was reported that the saber-rattling would also include large-scale joint landing drills projected by the U.S. imperialists and the puppet marine corps some time ago.
					
					 The planned joint military exercises are a continuation of the Team Spirit which brought the situation to the brink of a war in the light of their nature and scale.
					
					 They claim the projected exercises are "defensive ones" and the like though they are aimed to infringe upon the sovereignty of the Korean nation and push the inter-Korean relations to a total collapse but they can never cover up their true nature of their operations to invade the DPRK.

articles.title: Condolatory Messages to WPK Central Committee
articles.content:
Condolatory Messages to WPK Central Committee
 Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- Political parties of different countries sent messages to the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, expressing deep condolences over the demise of general secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 They included the C.C., the People's Communist Party of Kazakhstan, the first secretary of the C.C., the Communist Party of Kyrgyzstan, the chairman of the C.C., the Communist Party of Norway, the secretary of the C.C., the All-Union Communist Party of Bolsheviks and the first secretary of the C.C., the Communist Party of Chile (Proletarian Action).
					
					 The messages expressed deep sympathy over his demise.
					
					 They highly praised him, who made tangible contributions to the socialist cause under the uplifted banner of independence and justice, as peerlessly veteran statesman and the sun of the 21st century.
					
					 His august name and image will be remembered forever in the hearts not only of Korean people but of progressives, they said.
					
					 They expressed belief that the Korean people would successfully translate into reality the cause of building a thriving nation under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, true to the behests of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Preparatory Committees for Commemorating Birth Anniversary Formed Abroad
articles.content:
Preparatory Committees for Commemorating Birth Anniversary Formed Abroad 
 Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- Preparatory committees for commemorating the 70th birth anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il were formed with due ceremonies in Poland and Finland on Jan. 17 and 23.
					 The ceremonies elected Slaboy January Guzowski, chairman of the Central Committee of the Poland-Korea Association, chairman of the Polish committee and Antti Sika Aho, chairman of the Finland-Korea Society, chairman of the Finish committee.
					
					 The committees decided to widely introduce the immortal exploits of Kim Jong Il and the achievements of the Korean people and hold various events including meetings, photo exhibitions and internet seminars.
